Prey: Worms, crayfish, insect larvae, fish and fish eggs, snails, smaller amphibians, carrion
Fun Fact: Mudpuppies never leave their larval stage. This is called neoteny.
Estimated Population Size: Unknown, but its conservation status is least concern
Location: North America from Manitoba east to Quebec, south to Missouri and Georgia
Age of Sexual Maturity: Four to six years for both sexes
Name: Mudpuppy
